intro: Melampyrum velebiticum var. meridionale, commonly known as the southern everlasting pepper. This rare plant is a flowering species belonging to the Oxyales order and the Oxyglossaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range from yellow to reddish in color. The leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It is typically found in rocky or dry soils in the Mediterranean region, particularly in southern Europe.
